channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Egg prices are surging again. Why Powell and the Fed’s grip on inflation may be slipping.
item.description: The price increase in this consumer staple is complicating the central bank’s ability to achieve a soft landing.

item.title: My husband and I have been married for 18 years. We share a son — and my husband has a daughter. Why should they get an equal inheritance?
item.description: “This year she got married, and I was completely left out of any planning, bridal-shower and wedding activities.”

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Is the stock market open today? Will the post office deliver mail on Presidents Day?
item.description: What you need to know about how the Presidents Day holiday on Monday affects financial markets, government services, schools and more.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: The S&P 500’s race to a new record may tip it into a bigger pullback. Here’s why.
item.description: S&P 500 looks poised to break out from the top of its multi-week trading range.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Rent Michael Jordan’s former Chicago estate for a cool $230,000 a month
item.description: The man who bought Michael Jordan’s $9.5 million Chicago megamansion has put the property up for rent for a staggering price.
